CMCOPY NO.GOVERNMENT, war CABINET.$HE THORNTON PLAHT.Memorandum toy the Minister of Aircraft Production.At their Meeting on the 21st April, 1941 (W.M. (41)42nd Conclusions, Minute 6) the War Cabinet agreed asfollows:-"That enquiry should be made in the United states to make sure that sufficient capacity would beavailable and could be put at our disposal to meetR.A. F. requirements of 100 octane fuel in 1942 and1943. Subject to this the work of completing' theThornton plant should be discontinued. "It has now been confirmed that the necessarysupplies will be available as and when they are required.Instructions have, therefore, been given for work on theThornton plant to be discontinued.(Circulated for information)J.T.C.
